name: Aerosol Insecticide
description: Aerosol insecticides are not allowed in carry-on; however they are allowed in checked bags as long as they are not labeled as hazardous material (HAZMAT).

name: Alcoholic beverages
description: Alcoholic beverages with more than 24% but not more than 70% alcohol are limited in checked bags to 5 liters (1.3 gallons) per passenger and must be in unopened retail packaging. Alcoholic beverages with 24% alcohol or less are not subject to limitations in checked bags. Mini bottles of alcohol in carry-on must be able to comfortably fit into a single quart-sized bag.For more information, see FAA regulation: 49 CFR 175.10(a)(4).

name: Alcoholic beverages over 140 proof
description: Alcoholic beverages with more than 70% alcohol (up to 140 proof), including grain alcohol and 151 proof rum. For more information, see FAA regulation: 49 CFR 175.10(a)(4).

name: Ammunition
description: Check with your airline if ammunition is allowed in checked bags. Small arms ammunitions must be securely packed in fiber, wood or metal boxes or other packaging specifically designed to carry small amounts of ammunition. Ask the airline about limitations or fees. Read the guidelines for traveling with firearms.When traveling, be sure to comply with the laws concerning possession of firearms as they vary by local, state and international government.

name: Antlers
description: You may transport this item in carry-on or checked bags. For items you wish to carry on, you should check with the airline to ensure that the item will fit in the overhead bin or underneath the seat of the airplane.

name: Baby Carrier
description: You may transport this item in carry-on or checked bags. For items you wish to carry on, you should check with the airline to ensure that the item will fit in the overhead bin or underneath the seat of the airplane.

name: Baby Food
description: Baby food is allowed in reasonable quantities in carry-on bags. Remove these items from your carry-on bag to be screened separately from the rest of your belongings. Please see traveling with children for more information.

name: Baby Formula
description: Formula, breast milk and juice are allowed in reasonable quantities in carry-on bags. Remove these items from your carry-on bag to be screened separately from the rest of your belongings. You do not need to travel with your child to bring breast milk. Please see traveling with children for more information.

name: Baseball Bats
description: Sports equipment that can be used as a bludgeon (such as bats and clubs) is prohibited in the cabin of the plane and must be transported in your checked baggage.

name: BB Guns
description: Check with your airline to see if they allow firearms in checked bags. Read the guidelines for traveling with firearms.When traveling, be sure to comply with the laws concerning possession of firearms as they vary by local, state and international government.

name: Belts, Clothes and Shoes
description: To help TSA officers get a clear look at your bag and reduce the need for additional screening, we suggest you pack your bag in neat layers.

name: Blender
description: Blenders are allowed in carry-on bags if the blade has been removed.Any sharp objects in checked bags should be sheathed or securely wrapped to prevent injury to baggage handlers and inspectors.

name: Blood Sugar Test Kit
description: Please notify the TSA officer that you have diabetes and are carrying your supplies with you. Insulin pumps and supplies must be accompanied by insulin, and insulin in any form or dispenser must be clearly identified.Learn more about transporting medication on your next flight.

name: Bobby Pins
keywords: hair, hair accessories, hair clips, hairclips

name: Body Armor
description: Generally, body armor is allowed in carry-on or checked bags. Please note however that even if an item is generally allowed, our officers make the final decision on whether an item is allowed through the checkpoint.

name: Bowling Balls
description: Sports equipment that can be used as a bludgeon (such as bats and clubs) is prohibited in the cabin of the plane and must be transported in your checked bags.

name: Bowling Pins
description: Sports equipment that can be used as a bludgeon (such as bats and clubs) is prohibited in the cabin of the plane and must be transported in your checked baggage.

name: Box Cutters
description: Any sharp objects in checked bags should be sheathed or securely wrapped to prevent injury to baggage handlers and inspectors.

name: Bread Machine
description: You may transport this item in carry-on or checked bags. For items you wish to carry on, you should check with the airline to ensure that the item will fit in the overhead bin or underneath the seat of the airplane.

name: Breast Milk
description: Formula, breast milk and juice are allowed in reasonable quantities in carry-on bags. Remove these items from your carry-on bag to be screened separately from the rest of your belongings. You do not need to travel with your child to bring breast milk. Please see traveling with children for more information.

name: Butane Curling Irons (cordless)
description: Cordless curling irons containing a gas cartridge and butane fueled curling irons are allowed in carry-on bags only.A safety cover must be securely fitted over the heating element. The device must be protected from accidental activation.Gas refills (spare cartridges) are not allowed in either checked or carry-on bags.

name: Camera Monopod
description: You may transport this item in carry-on or checked bags. For items you wish to carry on, you should check with the airline to ensure that the item will fit in the overhead bin or underneath the seat of the airplane.

name: Camp stoves
description: Camp stoves are allowed in carry-on or checked bags only if they are empty of all fuel and cleaned so that no fuel vapors or residue remain. Please wrap cords and layer items in bags so officers can get a clear view of the items.

name: Canes
description: Please visit our special procedures page for information on traveling through the checkpoint with a cane.

name: Canned Foods
description: There are some items that are not on the prohibited items list, but because of how they appear on the X-ray, security concerns, or impact of the 3-1-1 rules for liquids, gels and aerosols, they could require additional screening that might result in the item not being allowed through the checkpoint. We suggest that you pack this item in your checked bag, ship it to your destination or leave it at home.

name: Car Parts
description: Car engine parts and other car parts without fuel or traces of fuel are allowed in carry-on or checked bags. Car engine parts may be placed in checked bags only if the parts are packed in their original box and free of gasoline and oil.For items you wish to carry on, you should check with the airline to ensure that the item will fit in the overhead bin or underneath the seat of the airplane.If you have questions regarding hazardous materials regulations, please see the FAA website.

name: Child Car Seat
description: You may transport this item in carry-on or checked bags. For items you wish to carry on, you should check with the airline to ensure that the item will fit in the overhead bin or underneath the seat of the airplane.

name: Cigar Cutters
description: Any sharp objects in checked bags should be sheathed or securely wrapped to prevent injury to baggage handlers and inspectors.

name: CO2 Cartridge
description: Except for personal medical oxygen cylinders, you can only carry an EMPTY compressed gas cylinder onboard a plane. To be permitted (in either carry-on or checked baggage), it must be clearly visible to the TSA officer that the cylinder is empty.

name: CO2 Cartridge for Life Vest
description: You may bring a life vest with up to two CO2 cartridges inside, plus two spare cartridges in your carry-on or checked bag.Even if an item is generally permitted, it may be subject to additional screening or not allowed through the checkpoint if it triggers an alarm during the screening process, appears to have been tampered with, or poses other security concerns. The final decision rests with TSA on whether to allow any items on the plane.

name: Coffee Thermos (empty)
description: You may take empty drink containers through the checkpoint and fill them afterward.

name: Coffee/Espresso Maker
description: Please carefully pack your electronics items and make sure all cords are wrapped. While you can pack expensive, fragile electronics items in checked or carry-on bags, we recommend packing them in your carry-on.

name: Compressed Air Guns
description: Including paintball markers, may be carried in checked baggage without compressed air cylinder attached.

name: Contact Lenses
description: TSA allows larger amounts of medically necessary liquids, gels, and aerosols in reasonable quantities for your trip, but you must declare them to security officers at the checkpoint for inspection.Learn more about transporting medication on your next flight.

name: Cooked Meat, Seafood and Vegetable (No Liquid)
description: You may transport this item in carry-on or checked bags. For items you wish to carry on, you should check with the airline to ensure that the item will fit in the overhead bin or underneath the seat of the airplane.

name: Corkscrews (with blade)
description: Any sharp objects in checked bags should be sheathed or securely wrapped to prevent injury to baggage handlers and inspectors.

name: Cremated Remains
description: We understand how painful losing a loved one is and we treat crematory remains with respect. Some airlines do not allow cremated remains in checked bags, so please check with your airline to learn more about possible restrictions.To facilitate screening, we suggest that you purchase a temporary or permanent crematory container made of a lighter weight material, such as wood or plastic. If the container is made of a material that generates an opaque image, TSA officers will not be able to clearly determine what is inside the container and the container will not be allowed. Out of respect for the deceased, TSA officers will not open a container, even if requested by the passenger.

name: Crochet Hooks
description: Any sharp objects in checked bags should be sheathed or securely wrapped to prevent injury to baggage handlers and inspectors.

name: Digital Cameras
description: For items you wish to carry on, you should check with the airline to ensure that the item will fit in the overhead bin or underneath the seat of the airplane.

name: Disposable and Zippo Lighters
description: Disposable and Zippo lighters without fuel are allowed in checked bags. Lighters with fuel are prohibited in checked bags, unless they adhere to the Department of Transportation exemption, which allows up to two fueled lighters if properly enclosed in a DOT approved case.

name: Disposable Razor
description: Any sharp objects in checked bags should be sheathed or securely wrapped to prevent injury to baggage handlers and inspectors.

name: Drills and Drill Bits
description: Tools longer than 7 inches (measured from end to end when assembled) are prohibited in carry-on baggage including cordless portable power drills.

name: Drones
description: Drones are allowed through the checkpoint. Please check with your airline for their policy.

name: Drumsticks
description: Musical instruments must undergo screening when transported as carry-on or in checked bags. Musical instruments transported as carry-on require a physical inspection at the security checkpoint. Inform the TSA officer if your instrument requires special care and handling. Pack brass instruments in your checked bags.

name: Dry batteries (AA, AAA, C, and D)
Dry Ice
description: The FAA limits you to five pounds of dry ice that is properly packaged (the package is vented) and marked. Airline approval is required. For more information, visit the FAA website.

name: DVD Players
description: For items you wish to carry on, you should check with the airline to ensure that the item will fit in the overhead bin or underneath the seat of the airplane.

name: Electric Fans
description: You may transport this item in carry-on or checked baggage. For items you wish to carry on, you should check with the airline to ensure that the item will fit in the overhead bin or underneath the seat of the airplane.

name: Electronic Cigarettes and Vaping Devices
description: The FAA prohibits these devices in checked bags. Battery-powered E-cigarettes, vaporizers, vape pens, atomizers, and electronic nicotine delivery systems may only be carried in the aircraft cabin (in carry-on baggage or on your person). Check with your airline for additional restrictions. Remove all electronic cigarette and vaping devices from carry-on bags if checked at the gate or planeside.

name: Engine-powered Equipment Completely Purged of Fuel
description: No amount of fuel may remain in the engine, including residual vapors.Even if completely purged, some airlines may refuse to allow engine powered equipment in carry-on if it has ever contained fuel.

name: Engine-powered Equipment with Residual Fuel
description: Engine-powered equipment with residual fuel (e.g., chainsaws, generators, trimmers, etc.) is not allowed in carry-on or checked bags. No amount of fuel may remain in the engine, including residual vapors.Even if completely purged, some airlines may refuse to allow engine powered equipment in bags if it has ever contained fuel.

name: EpiPens
description: TSA allows larger amounts of medically necessary liquids, gels, and aerosols in reasonable quantities for your trip, but you must declare them to TSA officers at the checkpoint for inspection.Learn more about transporting medication on your next flight.

name: Extension Cord
description: Please carefully pack your electronics items, making sure all cords are wrapped and any DVDs, CDs, or cassettes are removed from their devices. While you can pack expensive, fragile electronics items in checked or carry-on bags, we recommend packing them in your carry-on.

name: External Medical Devices
description: Inform the TSA officer if you have a bone growth stimulator, spinal stimulator, neurostimulator, port, feeding tube, insulin pump, ostomy or other medical device attached to your body and where it is located before the screening process begins. You may provide the officer with the TSA notification card or other medical documentation to describe your condition.Submit the device for X-ray screening if you can safely disconnect. Consult with the manufacturer of the device to determine whether it can pass through the X-ray, metal detector or advanced imaging technology for screening.If you cannot disconnect from the device, it may require additional screening and those in sensitive areas are subject to careful and gentle inspection.

name: Film
description: We recommend that you put undeveloped film and cameras containing undeveloped film in your carry-on bags or take undeveloped film with you to the checkpoint and ask for a hand inspection.

name: Fire Extinguishers and Other Compressed Gas Cylinders
Firearms
description: Firearms carried in checked bags must be unloaded, packed in a locked hard-sided container, and declared to the airline at check-in. Check with your airline to see if they allow firearms in checked bags. Read the guidelines for traveling with firearms.When traveling, be sure to comply with the laws concerning possession of firearms as they vary by local, state and international government.

name: Fireworks
keywords: party poppers,party snaps,firecrackers,aerial shells,bottle rockets,chasers,flying spinners,fountains,missiles,poppers,roman candles,skyrockets,snakes,snaps,sparklers,strobes,wheels,

name: Fishing pole
description: Fishing rods are permitted in carry-on and checked bags; however, passengers should check with the airline to confirm that the fishing rod fits within size limitations for carry-on items.Sharp fishing tackle that may be considered dangerous, such as large fish hooks, should be sheathed, securely wrapped, and packed in your checked bags. Like other high-value objects, you may wish to pack expensive reels or fragile tackle that does not pose a security threat (small flies) in your carry-on bags.

name: Flammable Liquid, Gel, or Aerosol Paint
Flare Guns
description: Flare guns in checked bags must be unloaded, packed in a locked hard-sided container, within hazardous material regulations, and declared to the airline at check-in. Check with your airline to see if they allow firearms in checked bags. Read the guidelines for traveling with firearms.When traveling, be sure to comply with the laws concerning possession of firearms as they vary by local, state and international government.

name: Flashlights
description: Flashlights longer than 7 inches (measured from end to end when assembled) are prohibited in carry-on bags; these items must be packed in your checked bags.

name: Flowers
description: Fresh flowers are allowed through the checkpoint without water.

name: Freezer packs
description: Frozen liquid items and gel packs are allowed through the checkpoint as long as they are frozen solid when presented for screening. If frozen liquid items are partially melted, slushy, or have any liquid at the bottom of the container, they must meet 3-1-1 liquids requirements.

name: Fresh Meat, Seafood and Vegetable
description: Meat, seafood, vegetable and other non-liquid food items are permitted in both carry-on and checked bags. If the food is packed with ice or ice packs in a cooler or other container, the ice or ice packs must be completely frozen when brought through screening. If the ice or ice packs are partially melted and have any liquid at the bottom of the container, they will not be permitted. You also can pack frozen perishables in your carry-on or checked bags in dry ice. The FAA limits you to five pounds of dry ice that is properly packaged (the package is vented) and marked.

name: Fresh Whole Fruits and Berries
description: Solid food items (not liquids or gels) can be transported in either your carry-on or checked bags. Liquid or gel food items larger than 3.4 oz are not allowed in carry-on bags and should be placed in your checked bags if possible.

name: Frozen Food
description: Meat, seafood, vegetables and other non-liquid food items are permitted in both carry-on and checked bags. If the food is packed with ice or ice packs in a cooler or other container, the ice or ice packs must be completely frozen when brought through screening. If the ice or ice packs are partially melted and have any liquid at the bottom of the container, they will not be permitted.

name: Fuels
description: Any flammable liquid fuel, such as cooking fuel, is prohibited.

name: Full Sized Video Game Consoles
description: Please place the console in a separate bin for X-ray screening.

name: Gel Ice Packs
description: Frozen liquid items are allowed through the checkpoint as long as they are frozen solid when presented for screening. If frozen liquid items are partially melted, slushy, or have any liquid at the bottom of the container, they must meet 3-1-1 liquids requirements.

name: Guitar
description: Please check with your airline for their policy. Musical instruments must undergo screening when transported as carry-on or in checked bags. Musical instruments transported as carry-on require a physical inspection at the security checkpoint. Inform the TSA officer if your instrument requires special care and handling. Pack brass instruments in your checked bags.

name: Gun Powder
description: Including black powder and percussion caps.

name: Hairspray
keywords: liquids, makeups ,make ups, make-ups, cosmetics, hair spray, make up

name: Hoverboards
description: Hoverboards are allowed through the checkpoint. Please check with your airline for their policy.
keywords: solowheels, airwheels, Airwheels, airboards, balance boards, balance wheels

name: Ice
description: Frozen liquid items are allowed through the checkpoint as long as they are frozen solid when presented for screening. If frozen liquid items are partially melted, slushy, or have any liquid at the bottom of the container, they must meet 3-1-1 liquids requirements.

name: Ice Axes/Ice Picks
description: Any sharp objects in checked bags should be sheathed or securely wrapped to prevent injury to baggage handlers and inspectors.

name: Inhalers
description: TSA allows larger amounts of medically necessary liquids, gels, and aerosols in reasonable quantities for your trip, but you must declare them to TSA officers at the checkpoint for inspection.We recommend, but do not require, that your medications be labeled to facilitate the security process.Learn more about transporting medication on your next flight.

name: Insulin
description: Please notify the TSA officer that you have diabetes and are carrying your supplies with you. Insulin pumps and supplies must be accompanied by insulin, and insulin in any form or dispenser must be clearly identified.Learn more about transporting medication on your next flight.

name: Insulin Pumps
description: Please notify the TSA officer that you have diabetes and are carrying your supplies with you. Insulin pumps and supplies must be accompanied by insulin, and insulin in any form or dispenser must be clearly identified.Learn more about transporting medication on your next flight.

name: Insulin Supplies
description: Please notify the TSA officer that you have diabetes and are carrying your supplies with you. Insulin pumps and supplies must be accompanied by insulin, and insulin in any form or dispenser must be clearly identified.Learn more about transporting medication on your next flight.

name: Jewelry
description: If you are travelling with valuable items such as jewelry, please keep those items with you at all times (do not put them in checked baggage). You can ask the TSA officer to screen you and your valuables in private to maintain your security.

name: Juice for Babies
description: Formula, breast milk and juice for babies are allowed in reasonable quantities in carry-on bags. Remove these items from your carry-on bag to be screened separately from the rest of your belongings. Please see traveling with children for more information.

name: Knitting Needles
description: Any sharp objects in checked bags should be sheathed or securely wrapped to prevent injury to baggage handlers and inspectors.

name: Knives
description: Except for plastic or round bladed butter knives.Any sharp objects in checked bags should be sheathed or securely wrapped to prevent injury to baggage handlers and inspectors.

name: Laptops
description: Please remove the laptops from your bag and place it in a separate bin for X-ray screening.TSA Pre✓® travelers do not need to remove shoes, laptops, 3-1-1 liquids, belts or light jackets. Please see TSA Pre✓® for more information.

name: Leatherman Tools
description: In general, you are prohibited from traveling with sharp objects in your carry-on bags; please pack these items in your checked bags. Scissors with blades smaller than 4 inches, small needles carried for special medical needs, and other sharp objects that do not contain a blade may be placed in carry-on bags.Any sharp objects in checked bags should be sheathed or securely wrapped to prevent injury to baggage handlers and inspectors.

name: Life Vest
description: You may bring a life vest with up to two CO2 cartridges inside, plus two spare cartridges in your carry-on or checked bag.

name: Light Saber
description: Sadly, the technology doesn't currently exist to create a real lightsaber. However, you can pack a toy lightsaber in your carry-on or checked bag. May the force be with you.

name: Liquid Vitamins
description: Learn more about transporting medication on your next flight.

name: Lithium batteries with 100 watt hours or less in a device
description: Lithium batteries with 100 watt hours or less may be carried in a device in either carry-on or checked bags. Loose lithium batteries are prohibited in checked bags. For more information, see the FAA regulations on batteries.

name: Lithium batteries with more than 100 watt hours
description: Lithium batteries with more than 100 watt hours may be allowed in carry-on bags with airline approval, but are limited to two spare batteries per passenger. Loose lithium batteries are prohibited in checked bags. For more information, see the FAA regulations on batteries.

name: Live Coral
description: Live corals in water and a clear transparent container are allowed after inspection by the TSA officer.

name: Live Fish
description: Live fish in water and a clear transparent container are allowed after inspection by the TSA officer.

name: Live Lobster
description: A live lobster is allowed through security and must be transported in a clear, plastic, spill proof container. A TSA officer will visually inspect your lobster at the checkpoint. We recommend that you contact your airline to determine your airline's policy on traveling with your lobster before arriving at the airport.

name: Magic 8 Ball
description: For Carry-on bags: We asked the Magic 8 Ball  and it told us…Outlook not so good!For Checked bags: We asked the Magic 8 Ball and it told us…It is certain!

name: Meat Cleavers
description: Any sharp objects in checked bags should be sheathed or securely wrapped to prevent injury to baggage handlers and inspectors.

name: Medical Marijuana
description: Possession of marijuana is illegal under federal law. TSA officers are required to report any suspected violations of law, including possession of marijuana. TSA’s screening procedures are focused on security and are designed to detect potential threats to aviation and passengers. Accordingly, TSA security officers do not search for marijuana or other illegal drugs, but in the event a substance that appears to be marijuana is observed during security screening, TSA will refer the matter to a law enforcement officer.

name: Medications (Liquid)
description: TSA allows larger amounts of medically necessary liquids, gels, and aerosols in reasonable quantities for your trip, but you must declare them to TSA officers at the checkpoint for inspection.Learn more about transporting medication on your next flight.

name: Medications (Pills)
description: Learn more about transporting medication on your next flight.

name: Metal Detector
description: Because of the size limitations of overhead bins and space under seats, this item should be transported in checked bags.Due to airline polices on weight and size of checked bags, you should check with your airline for any potential guidelines for certain checked items.

name: Microwave
description: Microwave is allowed through the checkpoint. Please check with your airline for their policy.

name: Mixer
description: Mixer is allowed in carry-on bags. Please check with your airline for any size or weight restrictions.

name: MREs
keywords: Meal Ready-to-Eat, Meals Ready to Eat

name: Multitools
description: In general, you are prohibited from traveling with sharp objects in your carry-on bags; please pack these items in your checked bags. Scissors with blades smaller than 4 inches and other sharp objects that do not contain a blade may be placed in carry-on bags.

name: Nail Clippers
description: Any sharp objects in checked bags should be sheathed or securely wrapped to prevent injury to baggage handlers and inspectors.

name: Nail File (metal)
description: Any sharp objects in checked bags should be sheathed or securely wrapped to prevent injury to baggage handlers and inspectors.

name: Nebulizers, CPAPs, BiPAPs, and APAPs
description: Nebulizers, CPAPs, BiPAPs and APAPs are allowed in carry-on bags but must be removed from the carrying case and undergo X-ray screening. Facemasks and tubing may remain in the case.You may provide a clear plastic bag to place the device in for X-ray screening. A TSA officer may need to remove the device from the bag to test it for traces of explosives.Liquids associated with nebulizers are exempt from the 3-1-1 liquids rule.Learn more about transporting medication on your next flight.

name: Nerf guns
description: There are some items that are not prohibited, but because of how they appear on the X-ray, security concerns, or impact of the 3-1-1 rules for liquids, gels and aerosols, they could require additional screening that might result in the item not being allowed through the checkpoint. We suggest that you pack this item in your checked bag, ship it to your destination or leave it at home.

name: Nitroglycerine Pills
description: Learn more about transporting medication on your next flight.

name: Non-Spillable Wet Batteries
description: No more than two spare non-spillable wet batteries are allowed as long as each battery does not exceed 12 volts and 100 watt hours.

name: Parachutes
description: You may transport parachutes, either with or without Automatic Activation Devices, in carry-on or checked bags.Parachutes should always be packed separately from other baggage. If a TSA officer determines that a bag must be opened to inspect the parachute, you must be present to assist in the inspection. If you are not within the screening area, you will be paged using the airport intercom system; if you are not present to assist with screening the parachute, the parachute will not be allowed on the plane. For this reason, passengers with parachutes are encouraged to add 30 minutes to the airlines' recommended arrival window. TSA is not responsible for repacking parachutes. All parachutes should be thoroughly inspected at their end destination to make sure that the equipment is still safe to use.

name: Parts of Guns and Firearms
description: Firearm parts, including magazines, clips, bolts and firing pins, are prohibited in carry-on, but may be transported in checked bags. Check with your airline to see if they allow firearms in checked bags. Read the guidelines for traveling with firearms.When traveling, be sure to comply with the laws concerning possession of firearms as they vary by local, state and international government.

name: Pellet Guns
description: Check with your airline to see if they allow firearms in checked bags. Read the guidelines for traveling with firearms.When traveling, be sure to comply with the laws concerning possession of firearms as they vary by local, state and international government.

name: Pepper Spray
description: One 4 fl. oz. (118 ml) container of mace or pepper spray is permitted in checked baggage provided it is equipped with a safety mechanism to prevent accidental discharge. Self-defense sprays containing more than 2 percent by mass of tear gas (CS or CN) are prohibited in checked baggage. For more information, visit faa.gov.We recommend checking with your airline as some may not allow this item in checked bags.

name: Pet food (solid)
description: Dry or "moist" pet food is considered solid food.

name: Pet food (wet)
description: Wet food must follow the 3-1-1 liquids rule for carry-on bags. There is no medical exemption for prescription pet food, even for service animals.

name: Phone Chargers
description: For more information, see the FAA regulations on batteries.

name: Plants
description: Check with the airline to ensure that the item will fit in the overhead bin or underneath the seat of the airplane.

name: Pocket Knife
description: In general, you are prohibited from traveling with sharp objects in your carry-on baggage; please pack these items in your checked baggage.

name: Pots and Pans
description: Pots and pans are generally allowed in both carry-on and checked bags. However, cast iron skillets are prohibited in carry-on bags and must be placed in checked baggage.

name: Printer
description: Please remove the printer from your bag and place it in a separate bin for X-ray screening

name: Radio
description: You may transport this item in carry-on or checked bags. For items you wish to carry on, you should check with the airline to ensure that the item will fit in the overhead bin or underneath the seat of the airplane.

name: Rainbow Flame Crystals
description: Many flame crystals contain HAZMAT. Passengers may bring flame crystals but only in checked baggage luggage.  Even if an item is generally permitted, it may be subject to additional screening or not allowed through checked baggage if it triggers an alarm during the screening process, appears to have been tampered with, or poses other security concerns. The final decision rests with the TSA officer on whether to allow any item on the plane. Passengers should check the product label for indications of flammable contents or other hazards.

name: Razor-Type Blades
description: Box cutters, razor blades not in a cartridge are prohibited in carry-on.Any sharp objects in checked bags should be sheathed or securely wrapped to prevent injury to baggage handlers and inspectors.

name: Recreational Oxygen
description: Non-medically required, flavored or canned oxygen containers are prohibited.

name: Remote Controlled Cars
description: Please carefully pack your electronics items and make sure all cords are wrapped. While you can pack expensive, fragile electronics items in checked or carry-on bags, we recommend packing them in your carry-on.

name: Rifle Scope (Scope Only)
description: Firearms carried as checked baggage MUST be unloaded, packed in a locked hard-sided container, and declared to the airline at check-in. Read the guidelines.Check with your airline or travel agent to see if firearms are permitted in checked baggage on the airline you are flying. Ask about limitations or fees, if any, that apply.

name: Rifles
description: Firearms carried in checked bags must be unloaded, packed in a locked hard-sided container, and declared to the airline at check-in. Check with your airline to see if they allow firearms in checked bags. Read the guidelines for traveling with firearms.When traveling, be sure to comply with the laws concerning possession of firearms as they vary by local, state and international government.

name: Sabers
description: Any sharp objects in checked baggage should be sheathed or securely wrapped to prevent injury to baggage handlers and inspectors.

name: Safety Matches
description: One book of safety (non-strike anywhere) matches are permitted as carry-on items, but all matches are prohibited in checked baggage.

name: Safety Razor With Blades (allowed without blade)
description: Any sharp objects in checked baggage should be sheathed or securely wrapped to prevent injury to baggage handlers and inspectors.

name: Samsung Galaxy Note 7
description: The U.S. Department of Transportation, with the Federal Aviation Administration and the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, have issued an emergency order to ban all Samsung Galaxy Note7 smartphone devices from air transportation in the United States. Individuals who own or possess a Samsung Galaxy Note7 device may not transport the device on their person, in carry-on baggage, or in checked baggage on flights to, from, or within the United States. For more information, read the announcement.

name: Saws
description: Including cordless portable power saws.Any sharp objects in checked baggage should be sheathed or securely wrapped to prevent injury to baggage handlers and inspectors.

name: Scissors
description: If packed in carry-on, they must be less than 4 inches from the pivot point.Any sharp objects in checked bags should be sheathed or securely wrapped to prevent injury to baggage handlers and inspectors.

name: Screwdriver (longer than 7 inches)
description: Tools longer than 7 inches (measured from end to end when assembled) are prohibited in carry-on baggage; these items must be packed in your checked baggage.

name: Segways
description: Segways are allowed through the checkpoint. Please check with your airline for their policy.
keywords: solowheels, airwheels, Airwheels, airboards, balance boards, balance wheels

name: Self-Defense Sprays
description: One 4 fl. oz. (118 ml) container of mace or pepper spray is permitted in checked baggage provided it is equipped with a safety mechanism to prevent accidental discharge. Self-defense sprays containing more than 2 percent by mass of tear gas (CS or CN) are prohibited in checked baggage. For more information, visit faa.gov. We recommend checking with your airline as some may not allow this item in checked bags.

name: Sewing Machine
description: For items you wish to carry on, you should check with the airline to ensure that the item will fit in the overhead bin or underneath the seat of the airplane.

name: Sewing Needles
description: In general, you may place your knitting needles and needlepoint tools in carry-on or checked baggage.Circular thread cutters or any other cutter or needlepoint tools that contain blades must be placed in checked baggage. You are permitted to keep scissors smaller than 4 inches in your carry-on baggage.

name: Shell Casings
description: Empty shell casings are allowed in carry-on bag as long as the projectile is no longer intact. They are allowed only if the primer has been removed or has been discharged. If the projectile is attached & the powder has been drilled out, it is considered a replica and not allowed in carry-on.

name: Shoe/Snow Spikes
description: Sports equipment that can be used as a bludgeon (such as bats and clubs) is prohibited in the cabin of the plane and must be transported in your checked baggage.

name: Skateboards
description: Skateboards are allowed in carry-on bags. Please check with your airline for any size or weight restrictions.

name: Skates
description: Including ice skates and rollerblades.

name: Small Compressed Gas Cartridges
description: Except for personal medical oxygen cylinders, you can only carry an EMPTY compressed gas cylinder onboard a plane. To be permitted (in either carry-on or checked baggage), it must be clearly visible to the TSA officer that the cylinder is empty. Personal oxygen is permitted if the regulatory valve has not been tampered with or removed.Unless being used for personal medical oxygen, the gas cylinder regulator valve must be completely disconnected from the cylinder (in other words, the cylinder has an open end that allows the TSO to visually inspect the cylinder). TSOs will NOT remove the seal or regulator valve from the cylinder. If the gas cylinder is sealed (the regulator valve is still attached) and not required for personal medical oxygen, the gas cylinder is prohibited, regardless of the reading on the pressure gauge indicator.

name: Small Fishing Lures
description: Sharp fishing tackle that may be considered dangerous, such as large fish hooks, should be sheathed, securely wrapped, and packed in your checked luggage. Like other high-value objects, you may wish to pack expensive reels or fragile tackle that does not pose a security threat (small flies) in your carry-on baggage.

name: Small Pets
description: Small pets are allowed through the checkpoint. Please check with your airline for their policy.Please remove your pet from the carrying case and place the case through the X-ray machine. You should maintain control of your pet with a leash and remember to remove the leash when carrying your pet through the metal detector. Animal carriers will undergo a visual and/or physical inspection.

name: Snacks
description: Solid food items (not liquids or gels) can be transported in either your carry-on or checked baggage.

name: Snow Cleats
description: Sports equipment that can be used as a bludgeon (such as bats and clubs) is prohibited in the cabin of the plane and must be transported in your checked baggage.

name: Snow Globes
description: Snow globes that appear to contain less than 3.4 ounces of liquid (approximately tennis ball size) can be packed in your carry-on bag ONLY if the entire snow globe, including the base, is able to fit into your one quart-sized, resealable plastic bag. Each passenger can only bring one quart-sized bag with 3.4 oz or smaller containers. Larger snow globes must be packed in checked baggage.

name: Snowboards
description: Please check with your airline for any size or weight restrictions.

name: Solid Foods
description: Solid food items (not liquids or gels) can be transported in either your carry-on or checked baggage.

name: Speakers
description: For items you wish to carry on, you should check with the airline to ensure that the item will fit in the overhead bin or underneath the seat of the airplane.

name: Spillable Batteries
description: Except those in wheelchairs.

name: Sports Cleats
description: Sports equipment that can be used as a bludgeon (such as bats and clubs) is prohibited in the cabin of the plane and must be transported in your checked baggage.

name: Squirt Guns/Water Guns
description: Water guns, toy guns, toy swords and other items that resemble real firearms or other weapons can look just like the real thing in an X-ray. Please pack them in your checked bag. Replicas of explosives, such as hand grenades, are not permitted in checked or carry-on bags.

name: Starter Pistols
description: Starter pistols carried in checked bags must be unloaded, packed in a locked hard-sided container, and declared to the airline at check-in. Check with your airline to see if they allow firearms in checked bags. Read the guidelines for traveling with firearms.When traveling, be sure to comply with the laws concerning possession of firearms as they vary by local, state and international government.

name: Steel Toe Boots
description:
To help officers get a clear look at your bag and reduce the need for additional screening, we suggest you pack your bag in neat layers.
TSA Pre✓® travelers do not need to remove shoes, laptops, 3-1-1 liquids, belts or light jackets. Please see TSA Pre✓® for more information.

name: Stuffed Animals
description: For items you wish to carry on, you should check with the airline to ensure that the item will fit in the overhead bin or underneath the seat of the airplane.

name: Swiss Army Knife
description: Except for plastic or round bladed butter knives.Any sharp objects in checked bags should be sheathed or securely wrapped to prevent injury to baggage handlers and inspectors.

name: Swords
description: Cutting or thrusting weapons, including fencing foils.Any sharp objects in checked baggage should be sheathed or securely wrapped to prevent injury to baggage handlers and inspectors.

name: Tea Kettle
description: For items you wish to carry on, you should check with the airline to ensure that the item will fit in the overhead bin or underneath the seat of the airplane.

name: Tear Gas
description: Self-defense sprays containing more than 2% by mass of Tear Gas are prohibited in both carry-on and checked baggage.

name: TENS unit
description: TENS (Transcutaneous electrical nerve stimulation) units are allowed in both carry-on and checked bags. If your doctor has told you that your specific TENS unit shouldn't go through an X-ray, you should notify the TSA officer so they can conduct alternate screening. To help you get through security more efficiently, remove your TENS unit from your carry-on bag and put it in the screening bin so the TSA officer can get a clear view of it.

name: Tent
description: Any sharp objects in checked baggage should be sheathed or securely wrapped to prevent injury to baggage handlers and inspectors.

name: Tent Spikes
description: Any sharp objects in checked baggage should be sheathed or securely wrapped to prevent injury to baggage handlers and inspectors.

name: Throwing Stars
description: Any sharp objects in checked baggage should be sheathed or securely wrapped to prevent injury to baggage handlers and inspectors.

name: Tools
description: Power tools and all tools longer than 7 inches (measured from end to end when assembled) are prohibited in carry-on baggage; these items must be packed in your checked bags.

name: Torch Lighters
description: Torch lighters create a thin, needle-like flame that is hotter (reaching 2,500 F) and more intense than those from common lighters. Torch lighters are often used for pipes and cigars, and maintain a consistent stream of air-propelled fire regardless of the angle at which it is held.

name: Toy Robots
description: For items you wish to carry on, you should check with the airline to ensure that the item will fit in the overhead bin or underneath the seat of the airplane.

name: Tweezers
description: Any sharp objects in checked baggage should be sheathed or securely wrapped to prevent injury to baggage handlers and inspectors.

name: Umbrellas
description: Umbrella is allowed in carry-on bags. Please check with your airline for any size or weight restrictions.

name: Unused Syringes
description: Unused syringes are allowed when accompanied by injectable medication. You must declare these items to security officers at the checkpoint for inspection. We recommend, but do not require, that your medications be labeled to facilitate the security process.Learn more about transporting medication on your next flight.

name: Used Syringes
description: Used syringes are allowed when transported in Sharps disposal container or other similar hard-surface container.Learn more about transporting medication on your next flight.

name: Utensils
description: Knives, except for plastic or round-bladed butter knives, are not allowed in carry-on bags.

name: Vaccuum-sealed bags
description: Vaccuum-sealed clothes bags are allowed but not encouraged. If they alarm, the TSA officer may need to open them for inspection.

name: Vacuum Sealed Bags
description: Vacuum sealed clothes bags are allowed but not encouraged. If they alarm, we may need to open them for inspection.

name: Violins
description: Musical instruments must undergo screening when transported as carry-on or in checked baggage. Musical instruments transported as carry-on require a physical inspection at the security checkpoint. Inform the TSA officer if your instrument requires special care and handling. Pack brass instruments in your checked baggage.Check with your airline prior to your flight to ensure your instrument meets the aircraft size requirements.

name: Waffle Iron
description: You may transport this item in carry-on or checked baggage. For items you wish to carry on, you should check with the airline to ensure that the item will fit in the overhead bin or underneath the seat of the airplane.

name: Water for Babies
description: Water for babies is allowed in reasonable quantities in carry-on bags. Remove this item from your carry-on bag to be screened separately from the rest of your belongings. Please see traveling with children for more information.

name: Wedding Dress
description: You can bring a wedding dress through the security checkpoint for screening, but we strongly recommend that it is packed safely in a garment-style bag or other packaging to protect it during the screening process. We also recommend that you contact your airline to determine their policy for bringing and stowing the dress on the airplane, as well as how it fits into their carry-on bag limitations.If for some reason your dress cannot fit through the checkpoint x-ray machine for screening, alternate screening procedures will be taken to clear the dress and your garment bag will need to be opened.

name: Wrenches/Pliers
description: Tools longer than 7 inches (measured from end to end when assembled) are prohibited in carry-on baggage; these items must be packed in your checked bags.
